description: Data dictionary for the Assignment Master file containing comprehensive personnel information including assignments, organizational hierarchy (WG1-WG5), seniority dates, and employment status.

fields.description: Reference number or row identifier for the record. Sequential numeric identifier.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Used as internal reference identifier.

fields.description: Complete name of the personnel member including title/prefix, first name, last name, and badge number. Format: '[Title] [First Name] [Last Name] [Badge Number]'. Examples: 'P.O. JANN ABERDE 386', 'CHIEF MICHAEL ANTISTA 265'.
fields.derive_rule: Source for parsing into TITLE, FIRST_NAME, LAST_NAME, BADGE_NUMBER fields.
fields.default_rule: Required. Should match pattern with title, names, and badge number.

validation.pattern: May contain titles: P.O., Lt., Sgt., Capt., Chief, Det., C.O., SPO., HCOP, PEO, CLK, DPW, TM, PLA

fields.description: Title or prefix extracted from FULL_NAME. Examples: 'P.O.', 'Lt.', 'Sgt.', 'Capt.', 'Chief', 'Det.', 'C.O.', 'SPO.', 'HCOP', 'PEO', 'CLK'.
fields.default_rule: Optional. May be blank for some personnel types.

fields.description: First name of the personnel member, extracted from FULL_NAME.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Extracted from FULL_NAME parsing.

fields.description: Last name of the personnel member, extracted from FULL_NAME. May include compound last names (e.g., 'LARA-NUNEZ', 'LOPEZ-AMAYA').
fields.derive_rule: Extracted from FULL_NAME field. May include multiple words or hyphenated names.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Extracted from FULL_NAME parsing.

fields.description: Badge number of the personnel member. Numeric identifier, typically 3-4 digits. May be blank for non-sworn personnel (CLK, DPW, etc.).
fields.derive_rule: Extracted from FULL_NAME field. Used to generate PADDED_BADGE_NUMBER.
fields.default_rule: Optional. May be blank for civilian/non-sworn personnel. If present, should be integer.

validation.range: Typically 83-2013, may be higher for PEOs

fields.description: Badge number formatted as 4-digit string with leading zeros. Format: '0000' to '9999'. Example: '0386', '0265', '2013'. Used for consistent sorting and display.
fields.derive_rule: Derived from BADGE_NUMBER using zfill(4) or similar padding function. Format: BADGE_NUMBER.zfill(4).
fields.default_rule: Optional. Should be 4-digit string if BADGE_NUMBER exists. May be '0000' for personnel without badge numbers.

fields.description: Organizational assignment or functional area where the personnel member is assigned. Represents the primary organizational unit (e.g., PATROL, DETECTIVES, TRAFFIC, COMMUNICATIONS). This field has been renamed from 'TEAM' to 'ASSIGNMENT' for clarity. Values include: PATROL, DETECTIVES, TRAFFIC, CRIME SUPPRESSION BUREAU, SCHOOL THREAT ASSESSMENT & CRIME PREVENTION, COMMUNICATIONS, ADMINISTRATOR, HCOP, RECORDS AND EVIDENCE MANAGEMENT UNIT, OFFICE OF SPECIAL OPERATIONS, SAFE STREETS OPERATIONS CONTROL CENTER, and others.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Represents organizational assignment. May be blank for probationary or unassigned personnel.

validation.notes: Field renamed from TEAM to ASSIGNMENT for semantic clarity

fields.description: First level of organizational hierarchy - Division level. Examples: 'OPERATIONS DIVISION', 'INVESTIGATION DIVISION', 'ADMINISTRATIVE DIVISION', 'CHIEF'.
fields.derive_rule: Mapped from ASSIGNMENT (formerly TEAM) field based on organizational structure.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Top-level organizational division.

fields.description: Second level of organizational hierarchy - Bureau/Unit level. Examples: 'PATROL DIVISION', 'DETECTIVE BUREAU', 'TRAFFIC BUREAU', 'CSB', 'COMMUNICATIONS'.
fields.derive_rule: Mapped from ASSIGNMENT (formerly TEAM) field based on organizational structure.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Second-level organizational unit within division.

fields.description: Third level of organizational hierarchy - Platoon/Office level. Examples: 'PLATOON A', 'PLATOON B', 'OFFICE COMMANDER', 'OFFICE SUPERVISOR', 'CLASS III', 'CLERK'.
fields.derive_rule: Mapped from ASSIGNMENT and organizational structure, particularly for Patrol Division (Platoon A/B).
fields.default_rule: Optional. Third-level organizational unit, primarily used for Patrol Division platoons.

fields.description: Fourth level of organizational hierarchy - Squad level. Examples: 'A1', 'A2', 'A3', 'A4', 'B1', 'B2', 'B3', 'B4'. Used primarily for Patrol Division squad assignments.
fields.derive_rule: Mapped from organizational structure for Patrol Division personnel.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Primarily used for Patrol Division squad assignments.

fields.description: Fifth level of organizational hierarchy - Currently unused or reserved for future use.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Currently appears to be blank/unused in most records.

fields.description: POSS (Personnel Operating System) contract type or union affiliation. Examples: 'PBA LOCAL 9 (12 HOUR)', 'PBA LOCAL 9 (8 HOUR)', 'PBA LOCAL 9A', 'SLEO2', 'SLEO3', 'SLEO4', 'WHITE COLLAR CONTRACT', 'CIVILIAN DISPATCHERS', 'PARKING ENFORCEMENT OFF'.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Represents union/contract classification.

fields.description: Normalized name format proposal. Format: '[First Initial]. [Last Name] #[Padded Badge]'. Example: 'J. ABERDE #0386', 'M. ANTISTA #0265'. Used for consistent name display and sorting.
fields.derive_rule: Derived from FIRST_NAME[0] + '. ' + LAST_NAME + ' #' + PADDED_BADGE_NUMBER. May be blank if badge number is missing.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Generated from parsed name components and padded badge number.

fields.description: Flag indicating if there was a naming conflict that required resolution. Values: 'YES', 'NO', or blank. Examples of conflicts: same initials and last name, family members with similar names.
fields.default_rule: Optional. 'YES' indicates a naming conflict was identified and resolved.

fields.description: Additional notes or special circumstances about the personnel member. Examples: 'NAMING CONFLICT RESOLVED', 'USING MARRIED NAME (MAIDEN: VALLEJO)', 'HCOP PERSONNEL', 'SAME PERSON WITH DUAL BADGE ASSIGNMENTS'.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Free-text field for special circumstances or notes.

fields.description: Personnel code identifier, typically derived from initials and badge number. Format: '[First Initial][Last Initial][Badge Number]' or similar. Example: 'JA386', 'MA265'. Used for unique identification.
fields.derive_rule: Typically derived from name initials and badge number.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Unique identifier code for personnel.

fields.description: Working group classification, typically matches POSS_CONTRACT_TYPE. Used for organizational grouping and reporting.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Often matches POSS_CONTRACT_TYPE.

fields.description: Date of birth of the personnel member. Format: M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY.
fields.default_rule: Optional. May be blank for some personnel records.

fields.description: Date when the personnel member joined the service/department. Format: M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY. Used for seniority calculations.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Critical for seniority calculations.

fields.description: Date when the personnel member was promoted to Sergeant. Format: M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY. Blank if not applicable.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Promotion date to Sergeant rank.

fields.description: Date when the personnel member was promoted to Lieutenant. Format: M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY. Blank if not applicable.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Promotion date to Lieutenant rank.

fields.description: Date when the personnel member was promoted to Captain. Format: M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY. Blank if not applicable.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Promotion date to Captain rank.

fields.description: Date when the personnel member was promoted to Deputy Chief. Format: M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY. Blank if not applicable.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Promotion date to Deputy Chief rank.

fields.description: Date when the personnel member was promoted to Chief. Format: M/D/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY. Blank if not applicable.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Promotion date to Chief rank.

fields.description: Employment status of the personnel member. Values: 'ACTIVE', 'INACTIVE', or blank.
fields.default_rule: Optional. 'ACTIVE' indicates currently employed, 'INACTIVE' indicates no longer active.

fields.description: Current rank or title of the personnel member. Examples: 'P.O.', 'Lt.', 'Sgt.', 'Captain', 'Chief', 'CLK', 'PEO', 'SLEO2', 'SLEO3', 'DPW', 'TM', 'PLA'. This is distinct from TITLE and represents the current hierarchical rank.
fields.default_rule: Optional. Current rank/title, distinct from organizational ASSIGNMENT.

validation.notes: Distinct from TITLE field - RANK represents current hierarchical position

field_rename_mapping.description: The field 'TEAM' has been renamed to 'ASSIGNMENT' for semantic clarity. ASSIGNMENT better represents organizational assignment/functional area, distinct from RANK (hierarchical title).

organizational_hierarchy.description: The WG1-WG5 fields represent a 5-level organizational hierarchy:

levels.WG1: Division level (OPERATIONS DIVISION, INVESTIGATION DIVISION, ADMINISTRATIVE DIVISION, CHIEF)
levels.WG2: Bureau/Unit level (PATROL DIVISION, DETECTIVE BUREAU, TRAFFIC BUREAU, etc.)
levels.WG3: Platoon/Office level (PLATOON A, PLATOON B, OFFICE COMMANDER, etc.)
levels.WG4: Squad level (A1, A2, A3, A4, B1, B2, B3, B4)

assignment_field: Field renamed from TEAM to ASSIGNMENT for semantic clarity
Distinct from RANK which represents hierarchical title
May be blank for probationary or unassigned personnel
seniority_dates: Promotion date fields (SGT, LT, CAPT, DEP_CHIEF, CHIEF) are blank if rank not achieved
Dates used for seniority calculations and promotion tracking
duplicate_fields: Some fields have duplicate versions with '_workgroup' or '_seniority' suffixes
These appear to be from merged data sources (POSS and Seniority lists)
Primary fields should be used; suffixed versions may be legacy/backup data
